page.title: 09RIVER CLYDE/PURIFICATION
page.content: {The Clyde Purification Board }monitors the river pollution.Since 1966 the pollution level has steadily decreased. This has been aided by the loss of heavy industry such as the steel works.The ammonia count and the biochemical oxygen demand have reduced.There is a variety of life in the river including trout and salmon.We found mayfly,caddis fly ,midges,black fly,beetle larvae, freshwater shrimp ,mites,water hog louse,leeches,flatworms,molluscs, worms and water boatmen.Plant life on the banks included foxgloves,Lady's Smock,Bluebells,Water plantain,Marsh Marigold,Garlic Mustard,Sedge, Globe Flower,Dandelions and Nettles.Trees included Horse Chestnut,Hawthorn,Oak, Hornbeam and Rhododendron. The Clyde at Daldowie is in a magnificent rural setting.
